metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6793 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
When processing an email message with an ill-formed envelope, Thunderbirdcould read data from a random memory location. This vulnerability affectsThunderbird < 68.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6793` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
